adjective.description: Relating to France or its people or language.

noun.description: The Romance language of France, also used in parts of Belgium, Switzerland, and Canada, in several countries of northern and western Africa and the Caribbean, and elsewhere.

examples: the French, they say, live to eat

phrases: Someone brought a guitar, too, and when I saw that, that's when I got the heck out of there, if you'll pardon my French.
The fact that the bill is bloody nonsense - excuse my French - should have no impact at all; we should just forget about it!
They wouldn't know an ulterior motive if it bit them on the rear end if you'll pardon my French.
You see, I don't know who sent these yet, because the chicken S.O.B., pardon my French, didn't have the guts to sign his name.
But pardon my French; Aidan was truly being a jackass in the ballroom.
origin: Old English Frencisc, of Germanic origin, from the base of Frank.
